properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Edwards, IL; White, IL; Posey, IN; Knox, IN; Gallatin, IL; Gibson, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 11:09AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Big Blue River...Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East Fork White
River...Eel River...Flatrock River...Mill Creek...Mississinewa
River...Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash River...White
River...Wildcat Creek...Youngs Creek...


.With rainfall totals between 1 to 2 inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Mount Carmel.
* from Sunday morning until further notice.
* At  9:45 AM Friday the stage was 12.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Sunday morning and continue to
rise to near 27.6 feet by Sunday January 19.
* At 27.5 feet...In the City of Mt. Carmel, all local roads flooded
east of the levee except for South Division.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
